pkgmetadata.longdescription: ### A module for visualization of a nested python data structure***a nested python objects including list, tuple, dictionary, tensor, ndarray to data-tree, and make a quick peek out of its structure```data = a list of 10 lists of 3 dicts of 2 keys : list of 2 stringsdv.viz(data)$ list of 10$ └── list of 3$ └── dict of 2$ ├── train : ['data1', 'data2']$ └── test : ['data3', 'data4']```### How to use***#### install```$ pip install dstree```#### import and quick_start```pythonimport dstree as dstdata = dst.get_example_data()tree = dst.viz(data)```#### usage in detail```pythonimport dstree as dstdst.quick_start() # Copy & Paste console output to set up the tutorial codes```### NoteThis package is built based on treelib & graphviz syntax. Supports int, str, float, list, tuple, dict, Tensor, ndarray, Series, DataFrame datatype. And also custom data classes are supported.
